main event: A brilliant white ball with a tail was seen on a straight flight path flashing from west to northeast, disappearing after being visually seen for 4 to 5 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only 4 to 5 seconds and was observed by both military and civilian sources.
The object was described as a brilliant white ball with a tail, following a straight flight path from west to northeast before disappearing.
Officials concluded that the sighting was likely caused by a meteor, with possibilities of being a balloon or an astronomical object due to insufficient data.
The object was observed to have gone through the traffic pattern at Oxnard AFB, making the event particularly notable and potentially risky for aviation.
The report includes coordinates and time details of the sighting, as well as the name of the senior officer who believed it was a meteor.
sighted object: brilliant white ball with a tail
